data.title: The Merchant of Venice: Old Vic (London), November 1980
data.meta_description:
William Shakespeare's Merchant of Venice at the Old Vic, The Cut, London SE1 November 1980 - the cast.
	
	David Sumner (Antonio) joined the RSC for the 1960-61 season. After the Mermaid Theatre and The Royal Court, he worked almost exclusively in television and films before returning as a director in 1972. He was Professor of Theatre at a literal arts college in the USA. He is known for The Sullivan Brothers (1964), Sierra Nina (1963) and Beau Geste (1982).
	
	Michael Dundonald Cochrane (Bassanio) is an English actor who specialises in playing suave, upper-class characters. He has had many television and radio roles.
	
	Maureen O'Brien (Portia) is an actress and author best known for playing the role of Vicki in the BBC science fiction television series Doctor Who, although she has appeared in many other television programmes as well. She played the part of Vicki in 38 episodes of Doctor Who from 2 January to 6 November 1965, starring alongside the original Doctor, William Hartnell. Over 40 years later, she reprised the role in several Big Finish Productions Doctor Who audio plays. Maureen O'Brien has also written seven detective novels.
	
	Timothy Lancaster West, CBE (Shylock) is a film, stage, presenter and television actor, with more than fifty years of varied work in the business. As well as many classical theatre performances, he has appeared frequently on television, including spells in both Coronation Street (as Eric Babbage) and EastEnders (as Stan Carter), and also in Not Going Out, as the original Geoffrey Adams. West has played Macbeth twice, Uncle Vanya twice, Solness in The Master Builder twice and King Lear four times. He is married to the actress Prunella Scales.
	
	Jacqueline A. Smith-Wood (Jessica) is an actress and director. As an actress she has worked in film, television, theatre and radio. Internationally she is best known for her portrayal of Mary Crawford in the BBC's 1983 mini-series of Jane Austen's Mansfield Park. On stage, she starred opposite Peter O'Toole in Man and Superman and Pygmalion. She has made over a dozen British television appearances.
data.text:
William Shakespeare's Merchant of Venice at the Old Vic, The Cut, London SE1 November 1980 - the cast.

David Sumner (Antonio) joined the RSC for the 1960-61 season. After the Mermaid Theatre and The Royal Court, he worked almost exclusively in television and films before returning as a director in 1972. He was Professor of Theatre at a literal arts college in the USA. He is known for The Sullivan Brothers (1964), Sierra Nina (1963) and Beau Geste (1982).

Michael Dundonald Cochrane (Bassanio) is an English actor who specialises in playing suave, upper-class characters. He has had many television and radio roles.

Maureen O'Brien (Portia) is an actress and author best known for playing the role of Vicki in the BBC science fiction television series Doctor Who, although she has appeared in many other television programmes as well. She played the part of Vicki in 38 episodes of Doctor Who from 2 January to 6 November 1965, starring alongside the original Doctor, William Hartnell. Over 40 years later, she reprised the role in several Big Finish Productions Doctor Who audio plays. Maureen O'Brien has also written seven detective novels.

Timothy Lancaster West, CBE (Shylock) is a film, stage, presenter and television actor, with more than fifty years of varied work in the business. As well as many classical theatre performances, he has appeared frequently on television, including spells in both Coronation Street (as Eric Babbage) and EastEnders (as Stan Carter), and also in Not Going Out, as the original Geoffrey Adams. West has played Macbeth twice, Uncle Vanya twice, Solness in The Master Builder twice and King Lear four times. He is married to the actress Prunella Scales.

Jacqueline A. Smith-Wood (Jessica) is an actress and director. As an actress she has worked in film, television, theatre and radio. Internationally she is best known for her portrayal of Mary Crawford in the BBC's 1983 mini-series of Jane Austen's Mansfield Park. On stage, she starred opposite Peter O'Toole in Man and Superman and Pygmalion. She has made over a dozen British television appearances.
